Message.Title: Trade pact with Russia all it takes to get bitter Washington rivals singing Kumbaya
Message.Msg: Who says Congress can't accomplish anything? The Senate today passed legislation to establish permanent normal trade relations with Russia, sending the bill to President Barack Obama for his signature. The 92-4 vote was a major victory for the business community. The legislation will allow U.S. businesses to expand their exports to Russia -- something other nations already are doing as a result of Russia's decision to lower trade barriers by joining the World Trade Organization in August. The House passed the Russian trade bill last month. Obama is expected to sign the bill promptly, since he supported the legislation.

Topic.Title: We are due for Reverse split for BAC???

Message.Msg: Why is this nonsense? Citi did it a few years back. The value of your BAC holdings would be unchanged with a reverse split, and a higher stock price would make this stock much less attractive to high frequency traders who are able to manipulate the price. BAC is among the highest volume stocks every single day. I own plenty of shares and am a long term investor, and would welcome a reverse split. I would also welcome the day when management is able to start a stock buy back program to reduce the float. This would be preferable to a dividend, in my opinion.

Message.Title: Considering suing BAC, seeking legal advice
Message.Msg: Hi everyone: I am a small business owner. I had a BOA business checking account for more than 2 years. I also have a personal checking and saving account with BOA. On Dec 4th, BOA suddenly freeze all my accounts. We did not know it until we called. I know that BOA has the right to close our accounts, but it is their procedure that put us in a terrible position. I am asking whether we can sue BOA for their procedures. I think it is very wrong for them to do 2 things: 1) They did not notice us properly. After calling I found out that they sent a letter on Nov 13 to inform us the account will be freeze on Dec 4th, and it will be closed on Dec 13th. Our business is internet sales so this is the busiest season. Closing our accounts at this time is killing our business, and ruining our family! This is the biggest thing in our life. They only send one regular mail, not a registered mail, no Fedex letter with signature. We did not get the mail. We do online banking everyday, we have several email accounts associated with the accounts, they did not even bother to send an email, or a message. In fact, they even sent promotion emails after they decided to close the accounts. This is very wrong. They don’t respect other people’s life. They now freeze over $100,000 in the 3 accounts. Now we are unable to maintain our business, we are unable to pay bills, pay our suppliers. We don’t even have money to buy food. 2) We arranged 18 bill pays on Dec 2, 3. Now they said that our accounts are freeze so there is no sufficient funds in the accounts withdrew all these bill pays. This caused a lot of problem because our suppliers are now questioning our creditability. There are also fees for declined payment, late fees. I think BOA did a horrible job here too. If they decided to close our accounts, why did they allow us to schedule the bill pays in the first place. Since our account is on freeze, why they are still send out these bill pays? If they sent them out, we have plenty funds in the freeze accounts, why don’t they just pay the bills, take the money from the freeze accounts? So in summary, I agree that BOA has the right to close our accounts, but the closing procedures is very very wrong. They should be responsible for all my loss. I plan to contact our state attorney general about this issue. I am writing here to see legal advices. If I plan to sue BOA because I believe their procedure is not right, do I have a case here or no chance at all? Thank y’all and Have a great weekend!

Topic.Title: Considering suing BAC, seeking legal advice

Message.Msg: Wrong board for legal advice.

Message.Title: TheStreet

Message.Title: Obamacare Bring Us Death Panels and Rationing
Message.Msg: here’s no crystal ball where we can see our future of national healthcare under Obamacare. However, there’s a very close model in the United Kingdom’s National Health Service (NHS). In fact, while we ponder the future of death panels and rationing of healthcare in the US, the UK is living it—and in many cases dying from it. So we can look at the NHS to see our future under Obamacare. It starts off sounding harmless. In fact, one may even consider it noble. But words like “care” are used to mask the inevitable consequences. Unfortunately, when the government begins to interfere in healthcare, it’s ultimately not about care or comfort, but rather about cost. The Liverpool Care Pathway (LCP) in the UK is a healthcare service that’s used when death is imminent, and it incorporates heavy doses of morphine to deal with what would otherwise be uncontrolled pain. It may seem to be a compassionate and empathetic notion, until you realize the system is being abused to serve as a fast-track pipeline to euthanize the most vulnerable patients. What began as an effort to relieve suffering is now ending lives at a frightening pace. Here’s how the numbers play out: Only 2–5% of patients require this level of sedation to control pain. Yet, the LCP has been involved in the deaths of 130,000 patients who were elderly, terminally ill, or seriously ill but not dying. This is 29% of the 450,000 NHS deaths each year. At many hospitals, over 50% of the patients who had died had been put on LCP.

Topic.Title: I guess Socialists cannot create jobs

Message.Msg: Very superficial and highly partisan analysis, Lib. This has been the weakest economic recovery since the great depression and the labor participation rate is nearing an all time low. Why? Because Obama and his minions have pushed a social agenda which included populist rhetoric against capital, writing thousands of pages of suffocating regulations, pushing punitive taxation of the producers and creating a healthcare system whose costs will be staggering. All this has created enormous uncertainty in the private sector. Small wonder biz has not been robust. What growth has been achieved is not due to Obama's feckless economic ideas, it iis due to the private sector, primed with an abundance of low cost money, moving ahead with margina investment. Resolution of the fiscal cliff on his terms will be a signficant drag on our economy.
